title: WHYYYYY Teambuilder???
body: Why did they change it so teambuilder is locked until level 25? That is completely unfair

In April 2014, we ran a low level Team Builder experiment where we only had Team Builder available for lower levels, and then turned off most of the other queues. We learned a lot from this experience including how players would react if they "only" had a Team Builder-like experience to play.

However, we ended the experiment around April 27th, 2014 and moved Team Builder back to Level 25 because we wanted to make some fundamental changes to Team Builder's design (like just having players choose Positions, not Positions + Role + Champions) and the matchmaking (how we distributed experience of players in a low level game because veteran friends tend to frequently play with their newbie friends). We also had a few design improvements to avoid new players getting trapped in weird combinations like "Taric Marksman" because they read the description of Taric and felt that it was appropriate, but then ended up being rejected from lots of teams.

We found out that some servers (like NA) had their Team Builder levels reset to low levels again, and left it that way for a bit longer to continue collecting some data to inform the new Team Builder Draft design.

We're confident in the new Team Builder design now, and believe it's a great experience even for low level players that can replace some of the low level experiences and really help players onboard into the League experience. So to avoid players falling into some of the traps in Team Builder "Classic" that I mentioned above, we're going to keep it at Level 25 until we can roll out the new Team Builder design. I know this might not be a popular decision in the short-term, but we're looking forward to having new players experience the new Team Builder design, and would rather them "level" up in League playing Normal Blind Pick for now because the queue times are just much quicker, and match quality is a bit better.

From now on, could you guys at Riot start giving a better heads up for when you do this shit instead of leaving everyone in the dark and eventually pissing us off?

This is really getting annoying. We at least get a warning about the patches with patch notes a few days in advance but a warning before messing with most played modes is severely needed since most people depend on this to practice and level in a comfortable way.

Bad decision.  Reducing options doesn't make new player experience better, and I'm speaking as a new player that is affected by this (level 23).

I don't imagine consolidating new players into fewer queues improves queue times all that much.  Queue time for Blind pick was already fairly low, and trying to make it even lower is like squeezing blood from a turnip.  Team Builder queue times could be long, but players are smart enough to make the decision for themselves whether they want a blind pick match now or a team builder match a few minutes from now.

I'm normally a huge supporter of the work you guys do with Social Play, but this post in general is a little weird.  Almost none of what you said here actually explains why this feature is being denied to players of level 24-, other than the following:

>We also had a few design improvements to avoid new players getting trapped in weird combinations like "Taric Marksman" because they read the description of Taric and felt that it was appropriate, but then ended up being rejected from lots of teams.

Can we talk about this, please?  You are denying an entire feature to your low level players because of a possible usage trap, one that should be absurdly obvious to basically everyone that has played more than five matchmade games.  

I'm aware that "Taric Marksman" is just an example, but in what world would players read a description of a man in heavy armor holding a massive hammer and think "yep, totally a marksman"?  C'mon.  

Besides, every champion is specifically listed as falling under applicable classifications in the Champions tab; are you expecting that your new players not only don't understand the delineation but will refuse to use any of the information features present in the client?

>would rather them "level" up in League playing Normal Blind Pick for now because the queue times are just much quicker, and match quality is a bit better.

This part makes more sense.  That being said, wouldn't something like a quick pop-up (e.g. "Team Builder generally has longer queue times than Blind Pick until ~ level 25") accomplish roughly the same thing while still allowing players that are particularly enamored with Team Builder to continue using it?

Why not just leave it on while you guys work? I don't see any disadvantage for having it at lower levels. My girlfriend who is only level 11 I believe with only 2 or 3 champions owned hardly ever gets time to play between being a wonderful stay at home mom and all the other stuff in the day like eating and sleeping the few games she gets to play she wants to play a certain character in a certain role on the map and be able to enjoy her experience even when winning or losing. These restrictions force her into left click war and potential battle in the lobby with another player which could lead to potential toxic situations or trolling or even undeserved reporting all of which could be avoided with the lifting of the restriction and reverting it to the previous state it was in. This is just a complete obstruction of fun with no benefits to Riot that I can see and I believe deters brand new and rookie players from wanting to jump into a game anytime and know what they will be doing going into the game and mastering each part if the game in their own way and style with little to no negative effects to the community. I beg you to reconsider this decision Riot for all players as well as myself and my lovely girlfriend who have an absolute blast with what you guys create and let us enjoy with you.
Oh ok. That's cool. But can you tell us when the new system rolls out?

The thing is, just because a player is lower level doesn't mean they're necessarily inexperienced. I play a lot of games with the same group of 4 other people - one of whom is a Smite veteran, but relatively new to league and thus only level 8. He occasionally wins his lane against level 30s... not frequently, but often enough that it isn't a fluke. He has enough game knowledge that he won't accidentally go Support Renekton or something.

Level 25 takes a LONG time to reach without buying XP bonuses, and it's easy for us level 30s to forget that. I totally understand raising the level cap for Team Builder, especially because of the concern for new players/players with less ingame knowledge, but 25 is way too high, and I don't see why you can't make exceptions for situations like lower-level players being invited by higher-level players.

Well, I guess that's an improvement. Looking forward to the change. It's a little frustrating having nothing but Blind Pick available right now though (I'm only Lv.15 at the time of this post). Thankfully I usually play support, which is often in demand, but it's not uncommon to jump in and have three people call ADC and then all lock in their characters, and off we go into a match with an incredibly odd team combination (that usually doesn't end in victory).

I just need to convince my friends to play more so we can plan out our team compilation before we dive in. Queuing in solo is a mixed bag at this point until either 1) I reach Lv.25 or 2) they bring back Team Builder. I'm guessing I'll get to #1 first though...

I think this is a good idea. This is because teambuilder doesn't take into account player's level or ELO (divisions) when it comes to putting you matched with players. This will prevent newer players (25 and below) from being placed against extremely high divisions compared to them. Unfortunate for lower level players yes, however, it does in fact make sense. Will allow new players to primarily play against players in their skill level, or level in general.

~Spheres
